V13: Configuration

V13.1: Configuration Documentation
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V13.1.1Verify that all communication needs for the application are documented. This must include external services which the application relies upon and cases where an end user might be able to provide an external location to which the application will then connect.🕵️ Manual Check RequiredAutomated check not implemented.Manual review: Verify that all communication needs for the application are documented. This must include external services which the application relies upon and cases where an end user might be able to provide an external location to which the application will then connect. - Inspect relevant code, configuration, and documentation. - Interview developers if needed. - Test the application for this control.
V13.1.2Verify that for each service the application uses, the documentation defines the maximum number of concurrent connections (e.g., connection pool limits) and how the application behaves when that limit is reached, including any fallback or recovery mechanisms, to prevent denial of service conditions.✅ PassTLS/HTTPS/SSL/certificate/mTLS logic found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validateConfig.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\tsconfig.json, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml, juice-shop-master\.github\ISSUE_TEMPLATE\config.yml
V13.1.3Verify that the application documentation defines resource‑management strategies for every external system or service it uses (e.g., databases, file handles, threads, HTTP connections). This should include resource‑release procedures, timeout settings, failure handling, and where retry logic is implemented, specifying retry limits, delays, and back‑off algorithms. For synchronous HTTP request–response operations it should mandate short timeouts and either disable retries or strictly limit retries to prevent cascading delays and resource exhaustion.✅ PassSession management logic found in: juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_1.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth-enter\two-factor-auth-enter.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth-enter\two-factor-auth-enter.component.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\token-sale\token-sale.component.ts, juice-shop-master\test\api\authenticatedUsersSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\oauth\oauth.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\authenticatedUsers.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\tokenSale.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\two-factor-auth-service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth\two-factor-auth.component.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\token-sale\token-sale.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\two-factor-auth-service.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_3_correct.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\oauth\oauth.component.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth\two-factor-auth.component.spec.ts
V13.1.4Verify that the application's documentation defines the secrets that are critical for the security of the application and a schedule for rotating them, based on the organization's threat model and business requirements.✅ PassConfiguration/secrets/resource/limits logic found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\.dependabot\config.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\configuration.service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\configuration.service.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\config\test.yml, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validateConfig.ts, juice-shop-master\cypress.config.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\tsconfig.spec.json, juice-shop-master\test\server\appConfigurationSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\test\server\configValidationSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\routes\appConfiguration.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\config.types.ts, juice-shop-master\test\api\internetResourcesSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\tsconfig.json, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\tsconfig.app.json

IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V13.2.1Verify that communications between backend application components that don't support the application's standard user session mechanism, including APIs, middleware, and data layers, are authenticated. Authentication must use individual service accounts, short-term tokens, or certificate-based authentication and not unchanging credentials such as passwords, API keys, or shared accounts with privileged access.✅ PassAPI/web service security patterns found in: juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\i18n\az_AZ.json, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\xssBonusChallenge_3.ts, V13.2.4Verify that an allowlist is used to define the external resources or systems with which the application is permitted to communicate (e.g., for outbound requests, data loads, or file access). V13.3: Secret Management
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V13.3.1Verify that a secrets management solution, such as a key vault, is used to securely create, store, control access to, and destroy backend secrets. These could include passwords, key material, integrations with databases and third-party systems, keys and seeds for time-based tokens, other internal secrets, and API keys. Secrets must not be included in application source code or included in build artifacts. For an L3 application, this must involve a hardware-backed solution such as an HSM.✅ PassAPI/web service security patterns found in: juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\i18n\az_AZ.json, V14: Data Protection

V14.1: Data Protection Documentation
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V14.1.1Verify that all sensitive data created and processed by the application has been identified and classified into protection levels. This includes data that is only encoded and therefore easily decoded, such as Base64 strings or the plaintext payload inside a JWT. Protection levels need to take into account any data protection and privacy regulations and standards which the application is required to comply with.❌ FailPotentially dangerous function(s) found in: juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validatePreconditions.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\fileUpload.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\form-submit.service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\RenderPass.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\stats.min.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\app.routing.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\adminSectionChallenge_3.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\dat.gui.min.js, juice-shop-master\server.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\captcha.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\userProfile.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_1.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\insecurity.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\MaskPass.js, juice-shop-master\lib\codingChallenges.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\profile.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\OrbitControls.js, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\karma.conf.js, juice-shop-master\lib\botUtils.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\basket.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\ShaderPass.js, juice-shop-master\routes\videoHandler.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\contact.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\b2bOrder.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\utils.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\EffectComposer.js, juice-shop-master\Gruntfile.js, juice-shop-master\test\server\botUtilsSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\three.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\web3-sandbox\web3-sandbox.component.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\challengeUtils.ts. V14.1.2Verify that all sensitive data protection levels have a documented set of protection requirements. This must include (but not be limited to) requirements related to general encryption, integrity verification, retention, how the data is to be logged, access controls around sensitive data in logs, database-level encryption, privacy and privacy-enhancing technologies to be used, and other confidentiality requirements.✅ PassAuthorization/access control logic found in: juice-shop-master\routes\updateUserProfile.ts, juice-shop-master\test\api\authenticatedUsersSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\roles.ts, juice-shop-master\test\api\userApiSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\models\user.ts

IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation

V14.2.5Verify that caching mechanisms are configured to only cache responses which have the expected content type for that resource and do not contain sensitive, dynamic content. The web server should return a 404 or 302 response when a non-existent file is accessed rather than returning a different, valid file. This should prevent Web Cache Deception attacks.✅ PassTLS/HTTPS/SSL/certificate/mTLS logic found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validateConfig.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\tsconfig.json, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml, juice-shop-master\.github\ISSUE_TEMPLATE\config.yml
V14.2.6Verify that the application only returns the minimum required sensitive data for the application's functionality. For example, only returning some of the digits of a credit card number and not the full number. V14.3: Client-side Data Protection
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V14.3.1Verify that authenticated data is cleared from client storage, such as the browser DOM, after the client or session is terminated. The 'Clear-Site-Data' HTTP response header field may be able to help with this but the client-side should also be able to clear up if the server connection is not available when the session is terminated.✅ PassFrontend security headers/cookie settings found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\configuration.service.ts, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\insecurity.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\test\server\insecuritySpec.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\config.types.ts, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml

V15.1.3Verify that the application documentation identifies functionality which is time-consuming or resource-demanding. This must include how to prevent a loss of availability due to overusing this functionality and how to avoid a situation where building a response takes longer than the consumer's timeout. Potential defenses may include asynchronous processing, using queues, and limiting parallel processes per user and per application.✅ PassSession management logic found in: juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_1.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth-enter\two-factor-auth-enter.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth-enter\two-factor-auth-enter.component.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\token-sale\token-sale.component.ts, juice-shop-master\test\api\authenticatedUsersSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\oauth\oauth.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\authenticatedUsers.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\tokenSale.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\two-factor-auth-service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth\two-factor-auth.component.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\token-sale\token-sale.component.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\two-factor-auth-service.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_3_correct.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\oauth\oauth.component.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\two-factor-auth\two-factor-auth.component.spec.ts

V15.2.5Verify that the application implements additional protections around parts of the application which are documented as containing "dangerous functionality" or using third-party libraries considered to be "risky components". This could include techniques such as sandboxing, encapsulation, containerization or network level isolation to delay and deter attackers who compromise one part of an application from pivoting elsewhere in the application.✅ PassTLS/HTTPS/SSL/certificate/mTLS logic found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validateConfig.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\tsconfig.json, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml, juice-shop-master\.github\ISSUE_TEMPLATE\config.yml
V15.3: Defensive Coding
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V15.3.1Verify that the application only returns the required subset of fields from a data object. For example, it should not return an entire data object, as some individual fields should not be accessible to users.🕵️ Manual Check RequiredNo clear WebRTC/media/signaling logic found.Review WebRTC, TURN, DTLS, SRTP, and signaling server logic.
V15.3.2Verify that where the application backend makes calls to external URLs, it is configured to not follow redirects unless it is intended functionality.✅ PassFrontend security headers/cookie settings found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\configuration.service.ts, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\insecurity.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\test\server\insecuritySpec.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\config.types.ts, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml
V15.3.3Verify that the application has countermeasures to protect against mass assignment attacks by limiting allowed fields per controller and action, e.g., it is not possible to insert or update a field value when it was not intended to be part of that action.✅ PassSBOM/dependency/risky component logic found in: juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\basket\basket.component.spec.ts, V15.4: Safe Concurrency
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V15.4.1Verify that shared objects in multi-threaded code (such as caches, files, or in-memory objects accessed by multiple threads) are accessed safely by using thread-safe types and synchronization mechanisms like locks or semaphores to avoid race conditions and data corruption.✅ PassTLS/HTTPS/SSL/certificate/mTLS logic found in: juice-shop-master\config.schema.yml, juice-shop-master\config\fbctf.yml, juice-shop-master\config\defcon33.yml, juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validateConfig.ts, juice-shop-master\config\mozilla.yml, juice-shop-master\config\addo.yml, juice-shop-master\config\default.yml, juice-shop-master\config\7ms.yml, juice-shop-master\config\oss.yml, juice-shop-master\config\bodgeit.yml, juice-shop-master\frontend\tsconfig.json, juice-shop-master\config\juicebox.yml, juice-shop-master\.github\ISSUE_TEMPLATE\config.yml
V15.4.2Verify that checks on a resource's state, such as its existence or permissions, and the actions that depend on them are performed as a single atomic operation to prevent time-of-check to time-of-use (TOCTOU) race conditions. For example, checking if a file exists before opening it, or verifying a user’s access before granting it.❌ FailPotentially dangerous function(s) found in: juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validatePreconditions.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\fileUpload.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\form-submit.service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\RenderPass.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\stats.min.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\app.routing.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\adminSectionChallenge_3.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\dat.gui.min.js, juice-shop-master\server.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\captcha.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\userProfile.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_1.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\insecurity.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\MaskPass.js, juice-shop-master\lib\codingChallenges.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\profile.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\OrbitControls.js, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\karma.conf.js, juice-shop-master\lib\botUtils.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\basket.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\ShaderPass.js, juice-shop-master\routes\videoHandler.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\contact.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\b2bOrder.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\utils.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\EffectComposer.js, juice-shop-master\Gruntfile.js, juice-shop-master\test\server\botUtilsSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\three.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\web3-sandbox\web3-sandbox.component.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\challengeUtils.ts. V17: WebRTC

V17.1: TURN Server
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V17.1.1Verify that the Traversal Using Relays around NAT (TURN) service only allows access to IP addresses that are not reserved for special purposes (e.g., internal networks, broadcast, loopback). Note that this applies to both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.✅ PassCryptography/crypto/key/cert logic found in: juice-shop-master\test\server\keyServerSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_3.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\keyServer.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_1_correct.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_4.ts
V17.1.2Verify that the Traversal Using Relays around NAT (TURN) service is not susceptible to resource exhaustion when legitimate users attempt to open a large number of ports on the TURN server.✅ PassCryptography/crypto/key/cert logic found in: juice-shop-master\test\server\keyServerSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_3.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\keyServer.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_1_correct.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\accessLogDisclosureChallenge_4.ts

IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation

V17.3: Signaling
IDDescriptionStatusNotesRecommendation
V17.3.1Verify that the signaling server is able to continue processing legitimate incoming signaling messages during a flood attack. This should be achieved by implementing rate limiting at the signaling level.🕵️ Manual Check RequiredNo clear WebRTC/media/signaling logic found.Review WebRTC, TURN, DTLS, SRTP, and signaling server logic.
V17.3.2Verify that the signaling server is able to continue processing legitimate signaling messages when encountering malformed signaling message that could cause a denial of service condition. This could include implementing input validation, safely handling integer overflows, preventing buffer overflows, and employing other robust error-handling techniques.❌ FailPotentially dangerous function(s) found in: juice-shop-master\lib\startup\validatePreconditions.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\fileUpload.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\Services\form-submit.service.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\RenderPass.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\stats.min.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\app.routing.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\adminSectionChallenge_3.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\dat.gui.min.js, juice-shop-master\server.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\captcha.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\userProfile.ts, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_1.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\insecurity.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\MaskPass.js, juice-shop-master\lib\codingChallenges.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\profile.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\OrbitControls.js, juice-shop-master\data\static\codefixes\tokenSaleChallenge_2.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\karma.conf.js, juice-shop-master\lib\botUtils.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\basket.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\ShaderPass.js, juice-shop-master\routes\videoHandler.ts, juice-shop-master\test\cypress\e2e\contact.spec.ts, juice-shop-master\routes\b2bOrder.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\utils.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\EffectComposer.js, juice-shop-master\Gruntfile.js, juice-shop-master\test\server\botUtilsSpec.ts, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\assets\private\three.js, juice-shop-master\frontend\src\app\web3-sandbox\web3-sandbox.component.ts, juice-shop-master\lib\challengeUtils.ts.
